required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Standardized Bundle Protocol to Optimize Outcomes With Patients Undergoing Gynecological Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Standardized Bundle Protocol to Optimize Outcomes With Patients Undergoing Gynecological Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Difference in outcome measures with the addition of post-operative evidence based bundle pre-operative education compared to standard pre-operative education given to patients prior to hysterectomy.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this project is to evaluate whether there is a difference in outcome measures (length of stay, occurrence of readmission, and patient satisfaction) with the addition of a post-operative evidence-based bundle/standard pre-operative education compared to standard pre-operative education alone that is given to patients prior to a hysterectomy (open, vaginal, or laparoscopic).

primary_outcome.description: Number of days spent in the hospital from the first post-operative day to the day of discharge
Re-admission within 30 days will be measured through the EMR
Patient Satisfaction Survey that consists of 7 questions utilizing a likert scale from excellent to poor

arm_group.arm_group_label: Post-op evidence based bundle w/ Pre-op education
arm_group.description: 25 patients undergoing hysterectomy from October 1, 2017 to December 31, 2017 will receive the post-operative evidence based bundle/standard pre-operative education.
25 patients undergoing hysterectomy from October 1, 2017 to December 31, 2017 will receive the standard pre-operative education alone.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are admitted for all hysterectomies from October 1, 2017 through December 31, 2017, who speak English, and who are discharged home.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are admitted for all hysterectomies from October 1, 2017 through December 31, 2017, who speak English, and who are discharged home.
